environment.dummy_env_rectangular_pin_spatial.Pin

class environment.dummy_env_rectangular_pin_spatial.Pin(relative_x: int, relative_y: int, pin_id: int, component_id: int, net_id: int)

Bases: object

A pin to be added to a component.

relative_x

The x position of the pin relative to the top-left corner of the component.

Type

int

relative_y

The y position of the pin relative to the top-left corner of the component.

Type

int

absolute_x

The x position of the pin relative to the top-left corner of the grid.

Type

int

absolute_y

The y position of the pin relative to the top-left corner of the grid.

Type

int

pin_id

The id of the pin relative to the component.

Type

int

component_id

The id of the component the pin belongs to.

Type

int

net_id

The id of the net the pin is assigned to.

Type

int

__init__(relative_x: int, relative_y: int, pin_id: int, component_id: int, net_id: int)

Initializes the pin. :param relative_x: The x position of the pin relative to the top-left

corner of the component.

Parameters

  • relative_y (int) – The y position of the pin relative to the top-left corner of the component.

  • pin_id (int) – The id of the pin relative to the component.

  • component_id (int) – The id of the component the pin belongs to.

  • net_id (int) – The id of the net the pin is assigned to.

Methods

__init__(relative_x, relative_y, pin_id, ...)

Initializes the pin. :param relative_x: The x position of the pin relative to the top-left corner of the component. :type relative_x: int :param relative_y: The y position of the pin relative to the top-left corner of the component. :type relative_y: int :param pin_id: The id of the pin relative to the component. :type pin_id: int :param component_id: The id of the component the pin belongs to. :type component_id: int :param net_id: The id of the net the pin is assigned to. :type net_id: int.

calculate_feature(component_x, component_y)

Calculates the feature vector for the pin.

update_pin_position(component_x, component_y)

Updates the absolute position of the pin based on the position of the top-left corner of the component that the pin is placed on.
calculate_feature(component_x: int, component_y: int) → Tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray]

Calculates the feature vector for the pin.

Parameters

  • component_x (int) – The x position of the top-left corner of the component that the pin belongs to.

  • component_y (int) – The y position of the top-left corner of the component that the pin belongs to.

Returns

The numerical feature vector for the pin, the categorical

feature vector for the pin.

Return type

Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray]

update_pin_position(component_x: int, component_y: int)

Updates the absolute position of the pin based on the position of the top-left corner of the component that the pin is placed on.

Parameters

  • component_x (int) – The x position of the top-left corner of the component that the pin belongs to.

  • component_y (int) – The y position of the top-left corner of the component that the pin belongs to.
